reviews.review: Simply exquisite. This relatively new museum was elegant and beautifully housed. There is strict crowd control here so there was no jostling for position to see the treasures inside the glass cases. The tour guide for our Road Scholar group provided in-depth explanation of the highlights so, if available I'd recommend using an audio tour to understand the history and significance of these treasures.
Imperial Eggs. The Imperial eggs were fabulous to see and the audio guides added lots of details. Went in the evening and there was only a small number of people in the museum.

A MUST. The Tripadvisor ranking of 12 out of 1600 attractions in SPB is well and truly justified. This is a must see - not only for the artifacts - but the building is worthy also. We could only afford 1 hour there but could have easily stayed there for a total of 2 hours. Don't miss it !!!

Another Must-See. This attraction only takes about an hour once you are in the museum itself. There are eight Faberge Eggs and they are stunning. There is a significant amount of other exhibits but the eggs are the main attraction and are worth your time. Advance tickets were not a problem, we just dropped in with our guide.

Excellent. We did this as part of a 2 day Alla Tours shore excursion with wharf pickup. We chose to include this museum visit instead of the tour with 2 more churches and a hydrofoil ride. Very glad we did. The museum building itself is impressive and the contents incredible. You can preview the Museum online at their own website. Our visit was better with a guide and only 16 of us. Got to see things up close at the same time as our guide was talking about them! This museum and the subway ride (great!) were not possible via our cruise ship. See also my review on Alla Tours - highly recommended.

Mrs. Was Great! Staff was friendly A lot of to seeing Was great experience Great collection and unfortunately we got a problem to purchase tickets an advance, because we from outside country and we was lucky hotel stuff was helping us for purchasing tickets
Wonderful museum . I really enjoyed this museum, it was very easy to go around using the audio guide. The palace it is in and the exhibits are absolutely wonderful.

A real surprise, so much to see, highly recommended.. We wanted to visit the gold room but tickets are very difficult to obtain and were advised to go here instead and we are so glad we did.It has not been open that long, about 3 years we understand, and is privately owned. You can book tours on line in your chosen language or you can book an entrance ticket for a given time slot. We were visiting in October which is not in the high season so decided to just turn up and were admitted straight away. We paid 600 rubels each which included an audio guide which I would recommend (we had to leave 1000 rubels cash deposit for each one but paid the entrance fee by card). You have to put shoe coverings on which are not easy to put on and not very big either.Once inside we were overwhelmed by the variety of Faberge items, the 8 eggs are only a very small part of the museum. There were many enamelled pieces, cigarette cases, boxes, tureens, paintings, just too much to mention.We spent over 2 hours there and were able to take photographs as long as the flash was turned off, we could have stayed longer but were totally Fabereged out by that time. Go before it gets too popular, they do have a maximum number permitted, about 300 I think, but I would not have liked to have been in there with that many people, as well as the organised tours.

Fabulous collection. What a great collection. Worth visiting.Rumour has it that the collection is on permanent loan by an oligarch to a museum purchased and refurbished by said oligarch on the suggestion of the Russian President.Not sure if it's apocryphal or true but it is a nice story!Entrance fee is negligible in dollar terms.Easily accessible.

A real Highlight. This museum was spectacular. Almost a spiritual and emotional experience seeing such beauty.Get the audio which explains each Faberge egg. These are stunning There are also other beautiful artefacts and paintings to see. The miniatures are exquisite and the light in the paintings is wonderful.You just must see this museum. It far exceedied my expectations after seeing the Faberge collection in Moscow.There is a lovely funky cafe and cakes with the name inAllow a couple of hours for a truly rewarding experience

Beats the diamond room in the Eremitage. Spent an hour in the Faberge museum just steps from Newsky prospect and enjoyed listening to the audioguide. A wonderful building and beautiful collection of treasures and of course the "famous eggs". We loved it!

Two Words-MUST SEE!!!. Breath taking beautiful works of art and architecture are waiting for you in St. Petersburg. Not just at the Faberge Museum either. Admission is cheap R1,000 gets you two tickets and two tour by number handsets. The splendor of the pieces is unreal, I have been to Versaille, The Tower of London, Smithsonian and the splendor is amazing! Feast your eyes on some of these items.

a new museum with great examples of Faberge and other silversmiths. Amazing place with amazing exhibits including silver ware, enamel ware in lots of different styles hatpins clock picture frames boxes including 6 or so Czar surprise eggs and some other eggs for other people, lots to see and some paintings and porcelain.The state carriage egg was amazing - it took 18 months to make and doors and wheels work like the original which only took 6 months to build!Most importantly You can take photos of the exhibits
Wow artefacts in a fabulous building.. What a collection of bejewelled finery-see why the Tsars met their sticky end-all contained in a magnificent old palace.

So much to take in. A fabulous museum - allow around 2 hours to see it all. An audio guide makes it more interesting and is only a few roubles more. The largest collection of Faberge Eggs in the world plus an amazing display of silverware, timepieces, jewellery, jade all set in Shuvalov Palace.
not sure. Although the faberge eggs are magnificent, I really didnt think this museum is the best.... very small and only some eggs on display..
Faberge eggs. Worth seeing. The exhibit of Faberge eggs is astonishingly beautiful. Get the audio guide so that you can hear the detailed history of each piece.

Small, but very beautiful !. This is a very small museum in St. Petersburg, but one of the best. The art and brilliance of all the small presents and jewelries displayed here is outstanding. By the way, the cafe on the ground floor is a nice place and we liked the borsht ))

Beautiful museum. This is a new museum in St Petersburg. The collection is really beautiful and well organized. Although the eggs are obviously the leading ithems, many others wonderful pieces are displayed. Certainly worth a visit (1-2 hours).
Incredible!. Beautiful building and an incredible amount of amazing precious objects. So much detail and so much skill. Would have liked to stay longer than the hour we had before it closed.

A MUST during your visit!. This museum is soo beautiful. From the outside it looks like a normal building, but from the inside is sooo beautiful. The different rooms are just impressive! You will fall in love of the interior design! I highly recommend this place during your stay in the city. Also, the audio guide is very helpful.

Spectacular!. This is the only museum in St Petersburg that was not over crowded. The setting in this beautiful old building is perfect for the Faberge collection. All exhibits were enclosed in glass on all four sides for complete viewing. You can get an audio guide for information but I skipped that and just enjoyed the beauty and craftsmanship of the incredible collection. A must for Romanov history buffs!
Must see the eggs. The collection is fabulous. You can't believe the workmanship. They had more money than they knew what to do with. Not hard to see why there were revolutions.

Less than a baker's dozen..... Don't expect a room full of all the fantastic Faberge Eggs you've heard about...there's only about 9 or 10 eggs here. But they are beautifully displayed and the audio self-tour is very thorough. There's a DVD you can purchase of a curator demonstrating the intricate mechanisms...be on the lookout for that. The surprise...all the other beautiful bejeweled items from Faberge.
Wonderful colours. The collection of eggs were so beautiful as well as the other trinkets and ornaments I would not miss this museum.
Sights cannot believe. You will have such a great appreciation for the little, decorative eggs after viewing and learning about them in the Museum. Many took years to make. Wonderful tour.
Museum. Nice museum with nice work from Faberge. One of the must s in Sankt Petersburg. You should not miss this museum

Exquisite. It's hard to imagine how one man could create such beautiful ornate objects mainly eggs for the tsars.What is also interesting is there are men in black in each room, whereas in all the other museums it is women.

Like diving into a jewelry box!. Wonderful museum. The highlight is, of course, the Faberge egg display. It isn't hard to imagine the joy that the Czarina and her mother-in-law felt when they received these eggs. At the same time, looking at the pictures of the Czar and princesses, as babies, knowing their bitter fate, you can also sense the tragedy. The museum, a former palace (what else?) is chock-full of gems and jewels - definitely a place to feast your eyes. Don't miss this.
Well presented. The exhibits are a delight and the eggs are presented better here than any others we saw, either in Moscow or St Petersburg. Paintings very well lit too
Stunning Eggs. What a treat, the chance to see some of these magnificent creations in a charming setting. An absolute must but best with a guide.

Wonderful. This museum is a must see in St Petersburg. Of course you must see the wonderful collection of faerie eggs but there is so much more. Some lovely paintings and many expensive trinkets given to and from the Tears family. The building alone is worth a visit. Entry was 450 rubels.

Gorgeous eggs!. If you have never seen Faberge eggs, you must visit this museum. You can get very close to them and see very good details. They allow photography too which is not allowed in the Armoury in Moscow where they have more eggs. Just stunning.

Absolutely wonderful. We did the guided tour in English, pre booked tickets and had some problems retrieving them from the email the museum sent. We therefore headed to the Museum a little early to sort this out. A lovely member of staff, with perfect English,sorted the problem straight away so we headed to the cafe for some food (also wonderful) before our tour. The lady that gave the tour was extremely knowledgeable, the collection was a delight and the whole experience was way more civilised and pleasant than that more famous St Petersburg Museum, the Hermitage. I cannot recommend this place highly enough, it's superb.

Nice private collection worth seeing just for the imperial collection. The imperial egg collection is the highlight of the Museum the rest of the pieces are interesting as well for the attention to details and the silverware

Truly Beautiful. Fortunately we got here in a quiet time in the later afternoon and saw the magnificent 9 Faberge eggs they have in their possession, amongst other art works and object d’art form Faberge. Stunning in their design, brilliance and creativity.
Not a lot of information on exhibits.... ..unless you buy the audioguide. I believe this is the museum of the faberge firm which made many things not just the eggs. Not as good as the Armoury.

Interesting and beutiful museum. Faberge Museum is much more than just exhibition of beautiful Faberge eggs. You will get a good picture of noble life in Czar's Russia in form of jewelry, icons, furniture, tableware and much more. You can go there without booking an excursion, but you get much more out of it during a guided tour. There is also a nice cafeteria and souvenir shop, which you can visit even without visiting the museum itself.

The building itself is beautiful. When you enter, you have to go through security, just like in the airport. Afterwards, they ask you to get your tickets. I would suggest that you buy online. There is an English website that is actually working (yey). The visit is timed. If you buy a few days ahead, they allow you a 4 hour window. If you buy online last minute, you only have one hour windows. The admission cost is 450 rubles. I would strongly advise renting the audio sets. The rental cost is 150 rubles PLUS 1000 rubles deposit. I would suggest you bring cash as the couple we went with didn't have the cash and had a more difficult time getting the audio sets.The building itself is beautiful, just like the Catherine palace, hermitage, and Peterhof. The highlight is definitely the 9 eggs. They allow photos without flash. The photos one can take are still not as beautiful as the ones that you can get in their photo books. I would advise you to buy your "souvenir" book at home. Price is cheaper on amazon or indigo than in their store and you don't have to lug it back home. The Faberge egg replica is also cheaper/same price as back home so no need to pick one up there.The other wings have dishware, paintings, jewelry, and religious icons. You would spend probably 1-.1.5 hours here.

Definitely worth a visit. If you like history and opulence then this is the place to go! Fascinating to see the Faberge eggs owned by the Romanovs and other beautiful artefacts. We went in the evening and it wasn't too busy - plenty of opportunity to view the exhibits without being jostled.

Worthwhile Museum. The eggs were only the tip of the iceberg in this museum. The rest of the collection and the building itself were also a testament to the wealth and taste of the czars and their extended families. The artwork and the tiny mosaics and other pieces were worth lingering over.

Stunning. Its hard to describe the splendour of this Museum. The collection id magnifivent but The faberge eggs are something that surpasssed my expectations. carl faberge was a genius , a jeweller that has yet & may never be , replicated, It wa a privilege to be able to view just a small sample of his work
Faberge at it's best. A wonderful collection recently made possible in St Petersburg, be prepared to stay a while to view these beautiful objects .

All about the "Eggs". One of my favorite museums. This is a private museum that houses 9 Imperial Of imperial Fabrege eggs made for the Russian Czars. These were gifts they gave each other on Easter. They are beautiful and clever in their design. Each is unique. There are 14 eggs in..the largest collection in the world. The museum also houses a large collection of enamel boxes and cases. The colors and workmanship are superb. We visited here on our own without a guide, using the audio tour headphones. Once we figured them out we were able to follow the prompts. We also hooked into some English speaking guides for a small group tour and listened to their comments. It cost 600 rubles.

Faberge Egg display. The museum had many items from historic leaders of the area. The Faberge egg collection is the highlight. Our guide explained each in detail. Each has a case that allows viewing from all sides and shows what item(s) were contained inside each egg. This was just off a canal or river and seemed to have a place where boats could dock. Our Russian guide had arranged the visit so we arrived with no waiting time. We used Alla Tour.

Excellent place to visit, 'out of this world'. My wife and I did a personal visit on foot from our hotel. Absolutely amazing place, one just wonders just how they managed to get so many exhibits together, originals, in one place, wander through at ease, photograph anything. We spent nearly two hours there, it is worth a visit just to see the inside of the building, the exhibits are a bonus. (The leaflets explain it is organised tours until 1800 hrs, public afterwards, this is NOT enforced, we went at 1530 hours)

You have to go here. We stumbled across the Faberge Museum after a canal ride and it was AMAZING!! Had an english speaking guide that kept us enthralled from start to finish...if iI could recommend you do one thing out of the ordinary in St Petersburg...you must visit the Faberge Museum....its history will amaze you!

What a wonder. The Faberge collection displayed in the museum is wonderful. There are several rooms in which you can admire the work of this great jeweler. Obviously you can like or dislike his taste, which can be, perhaps a bit lavish, but what is undeniable is the perfection and extreme ability in the execution of his work.

Great museum, terrible boat trip. After seeing the wonderful, not to be missed Faberge eggs and other beautiful items in the museum, (the interior of the building is lovely too) we made the mistake of going on a canal boat trip directly outside, branded Faberge Museum. We were reassured bt a young man outside the museum that the commentary was in English. NOT TRUE. We were subjected to an incomprehensible Russian commentary. Furthermore the 'canal trip' was a short section of canal and then a slow journey around the Neva river. We complained and we're told that we didn't ask if it was in English. NOT TRUE. Very dissatisfied and we recommend that you avoid unless you want to be treated badly by cynical people who don't care to give tourists what should have been a wonderful boat trip.
Beautiful Museum Collection and Building. Amazing collection of Faberge and art. This is all well presented in a beautiful restored palace/home.

Fabulous. This was a really nice tour. We pre booked the English tour. There wasnt a queue and we had to meet at the bottom of the stairs 5 minutes before the scheduled start date.Our tour guide was brilliant. Her passion for the history of faberge was evident and while she has probably given this tour many many times, it came across as fresh and enthusiastic. She was clearly the best tour guide we had on our entire trip.The highlite was the eggs of course.The museum is located on a renovated mansion that added to the setting.Tour takes about 1 hour so it is a good option if you are time constrained.Note: I booked both entry ticketed and the tour tickets online but it appears that I didn't need to purchase the entry tickets - sigh.There is a cafe on site but we didn't try it.

Yet another St. Petersburg 'Must See'. The setting is beautiful, the exhibits are breathtaking, and the history is fascinating. This is a stunning collection of art - particularly the decorative arts - and the museum isn't just about the Faberge Eggs. But their primacy of their design, materials, craftsmanship, and place in history simply can't be denied.Our trip to St. Petersburg was all too short and I had to be convinced to go 'out of our way' to the Faberge Museum by my wife for whom 'The Eggs' have been a lifelong obsession. But I and everyone else in our extended family were delighted by the museum.

Beautiful eggs and masterpieces of silver etc.. I thought all I would see would be a room with the eggs. However it is so much more. Wonderful art and silver and gold workmanship by not only Fabergé but other magnificent jewellers.Do take an hour and visit this Museum just off the Nevsky Prospect.
Amazing "eggs" and so much more beauty!. The Faberge collection and history, in such a beautiful setting is not to be missed. Also, they have an exceptional gift shop for souvenirs from Faberge!

If you're into Faberge eggs this is good. If not, it's a bit boring!. I enjoyed several of the museums I visited on my trip through Russia - although the Faberge museum was so-so. If you are a big fan of the decorative eggs you will enjoy seeing them. The building is replicated and while it is attractive, far from historical.

Must see. If you have any space in your head for more opulence after visiting the Hermitage, then this is a must see. Absolutely beautiful craftsmanship; don't get so focuses on the showcases that you forget to look around you, as this is also an extremely beautiful building.

Awesome masterpiece of a collection. Located in beautiful palace with a collection of faberge and Russian silversmith work that is unparalleled. Provided an excellent education for this antique dealer. Definitely worth a visit if you have two hours. Audio tour worked well once I got the hang of it and the information provided gave excellent insight. Added the tour to a two day tour tour by SPB Tours.

Deserving of your time. I was not particularly excited by the thought of Faberge's eggs! But the museum offers so much more. The palace in which the exhibits are displayed has been wonderfully restored, the display cabinets and seating are modern and minimalist, and it tells the story of the work that Faberge promoted really well.The objects with enamelling were a revelation and beautiful. What is there is the best of the best. Lots of us stayed longer than we thought we would and it has an atmosphere where quiet consideration and pleasure in looking can take place for as long as you like!

Small pieces of art!. Very delicate with a good taste, they appeared as an answer to the banal gifts. I can say that this gifts touched the top of elegance and refinement. Here you can find the world's largest collection of works of Carl Fabergé, including nine of the famous Imperial Easter Eggs.

Beautiful Masterpieces & Detailed Audio Guides!. For people who like history and exceptional craftsmanship this is the place! The audio guides are not expensive but they required a steep deposit of 1000 roubles. The audio guides are about 150 roubles if i'm not mistaken. There are exhibits of Carl Faberge eggs, rooms and rooms of other pieces by the Faberge Group, paintings. There are very detailed explanations on the audio guide which is fantastic. You may use a camera but no flash allowed.

Surprised and delighted. The Faberge Museum was part of an inclusive 2 day tour by TJ Travel and of all the St Petersburg highlights it was the one I was least looking forward to. As it turned out it was a stunning exhibition of all that Faberge does best, not just Eggs but many other different and exceptional (exceedingly expensive) trinkets. I was a real delight to wander around the exhibits and see the intricate designs in every work of art. I thoroughly recommend it as an inclusion in your trip to St Petersburg.

Masterpieces of karl faberge in a chic small museum. We loved this museum. We had just finished the boat ride on the canal where the black bronze horses are at nevinsky project. We had to put our bags in the locker and put on tbe plastic bootees. You can have a linguist guide or do it yourself with a book as all the items are numbered. Each room has a colour and is well organised with various objects. Beautiful eggs made for the tsarina, jewellry, just beautiful. The architecture of the museum is stunning. Not tobe missed

Simply gorgeous . All I can say is that this museum was simply gorgeous. I recommend either joining a tour group in your language or renting the audio guide. I did it on my own and while I completely enjoyed every minute it would have been nice to hear about the items on display in real time rather than downloading a utube video after the fact. Definitely a must go!!!!
Fascinating exhibits. The museum is in a restored building. There are beautiful Faberge eggs as well as many other items designed by him. If you like Faberge, then this is a must.

A small museum with big ticket jewels inside. St. Petersburg feels like museum after museum, but make some time to see this one. It has a handful of royal Faberge eggs that survived the revolution, and the museum is small enough to keep you interested. If you do the tour, you will learn about the surprises inside each egg, lost pieces, and other history about the royal family. There is also some silverware, trinkets and paintings on display, but the eggs are the show stoppers.The souvenir shops around the city are crawling with knockoffs of these Faberge eggs, and if you don’t go to the museum you can’t say you saw the diamond and pearl-encrusted real McCoy. If you get there early, there is no line (yes, no massive lines snaking around the block like other museums). The gift shop has small pendants done in the Faberge patterns, at reasonable prices
See the famous Faberge Eggs. Take advantage of the rare opportunity to see 9 of the fabulous Faberge Eggs made for the czars of Russia.

Amazing! Superb!. We have been admirers of Faberge's works ever since we visited an exhibition of Faberge's works in the Victoria and Albert museum many years ago.We saw some of his works in the Kremlin museum about 10 years ago and that was one of the main highlights of our Moscow visit.It's great to see so many of his works here in the Feberge museum. The museum guide was excellent and although the tour was only for about 1 hour, she highlighted many of the items we might have missed had we gone around the museum ourselves. She also brought the history of Faberge to life.

Opulent. This is a very well done exhibit of some of the Imperial Faberge eggs that were sold back to a Russian business man, previously owned by Malcolm Forbes. Some are absolute marvels to behold. This is of course a small part of the collection. Faberge made a lot of other jewelry and accessories, like cigarette cases, lighters. Definitely worth a look.

Stunning. No trip to St Petersburg would be complete without a visit to the Faberge Museum. Situated in a beautiful private palace, I suggest you get there early when it opens for the best experience. Apart from the wonderful collection of Imperial eggs there are interconnected rooms with beautifully lit cases full of exquisite objects to enjoy and sigh over.

Small and precious . The museum is great with the kids, as it has the right size for the children not to get too tired and it is interesting enough. The museum has a very good restaurant with great food quality that is not too expensive. During our visit, we came here twice.
Very near to nevesky. A newly furbished museum. Must visit. very near to nevesky. Very nicely decorated and maintained. Entry fee applicable

Must see museum . If you want to see most of the only 12 faberge eggs in existent then this is the place to come. You get a full history of faberge and other things made in the era. It is worth hiring the tape to give you a background on the different rooms  & artefacts but don't bother with the guide . Not really needed. You are required to wear covers on your feet. You can take pictures but not aloud flash. Doesn't take that long either to go round.

Interesting, but not many eggs!. I visited here recently and was impressed by the building, the exhibition and the artifacts. There is also a very good system of labeling and numbering, accompanied by a guidebook, to explain what everything is, so you could spend a long time at a relatively small exhibition. Very interesting indeed - but I was slightly disappointed that there weren't more Fabergé Eggs to look at...!
Enjoyable. Just off Nevsky Prospect. You are given booties to wear and it is very quiet. There is an audio guide. Exquisite eggs. Other exhibits as well. A magnificent building.
How do you like your eggs?. I could have spent days in this museum. Such wonderful displays of art. I must have taken well over 200 pictures. Easy to get around and very well spread out.
Not to be missed. THis was an extra visit by Anastasia travel at our request and organised in a flash. A unforgetable experience
Really worth a visit. This is a small museum that really warrants a stop. The Fabrege story is a very interesting one and the products made are exquisite.

Small but beautiful museum. If you have enough time, I would recommend this beautiful little museum. It has some stunning pieces and serving sets that are so really beautiful. The building is also really nice inside. You don't need much time, I would say you can see the whole thing in less than one hour.

Very nice Museum to explore the Royal Gifts from Fabergë. We refused to stand in line for hours at the horribly packed Hermitage, so we were happy to find a place that wasn't crowded. It was absolutely worth the 3,5-hour visit through the Shuvalov Palace to see the lovely privately-owned collection of the celebrated royal russian jeweler Peter Karl Fabergé. We were enjoyed the royal Easter gifts in form of eggs with surprises, jewels, clocks, dinner and tea sets, silver and porcelain artifacts, paintings and much more. The place is not very big, but certainly takes a half day to see all the details.

What a grand museum!. We have wanted to see the Faberge Imperial Eggs since the 1970's when snippets were added to the end of PBS Masterpiece Theater programs. This museum did not disappoint! They posses 9 of the 48 eggs created for the royal family. Each is a treasure. The museum itself is a restored mansion. Besides the eggs and large silver pieces, there are, boxes, and many other personal luxury items and objets d'art . Don't miss this in St. Petersberg!

A Real Highlight. This was the highlight of our stay in this city of museums. Not as crowded as the Hermitage and filled with some of the most beautiful art I've ever seen, this place is a real joy to visit. Not to be missed.
beautiful objects. The museum is very well organized and the presentation of the Faberge artwork is done beautifully. This is not a large museum. Definitely worth the visit.

the Faberge Museum, St. Petersburg. This is not a big museum but has some most beautifully exquisite Faberge eggs ever produced for the Tsars. There were other very beautiful objects too and most had English explanations about them.The museum is not so crowded after 5 pm as the tour groups are supposed to go before 5pm but when we went after 5pm (just 2 of us) there were still a few tour groups. Generally not very crowded when we were there. Well worth a visit. We stayed for about 90 minutes and enjoyed the visit very much.
The craftmanship here is so incredible, amazing beauty.. Words cannot describe the beauty of these objects. The craftsmanship is the best in the world and probably will never be matched again.

Beautiful exhibits. This is a beautifully restored palace with wonderful displays. There are English translations of each of the rooms. It is not a large museum, but there are hundreds of items including a number of the famous eggs. You can take photos without flash. There is a very nice gift shop.

Much more to see than just the Eggs. Get there as soon as it opens at 10:00; ticket office opens at 09:30. Closed on Fridays. We and about 6 others strolled around leisurely at 10:01, no pushing to take photos or trying to make sure other people not in the photos of the individual eggs.We did not take a tour - first English one wasn't until 12:30 but audio guide is excellent. Other tours taking place later during our visit seemed to move people thru at quite a rate but you could return to revisit the items.9 major eggs were on display but there is much much more to see of Faberge's work - a wonderful visit. Highly recommend.
The place to visit for Fabergé fans. Excellent rich collection of Fabergé eggs (9x) and lots of other fine works of that famous company. A must see for Faberge' fans and Faberge' pros.

Wonderous objects.. Well worth a visit to see 9 Faberge Easter eggs presented to the Tsars. Entrance fee very reasonable. Went early on a Sunday morning and breezed through the museum. Pick up a free use catalogue if you don't want the audio tour. Please replace after use!

Nice but a bit dissapointed. I was somewhat dissapointed to know that there are only about 6 or 8 eggs in this museum...I was expecting to see much more. Although what you will see here is amazing indeed. There is an audio guide but I don't think it's worth it.Check this out if you have spare time and some rubles...it takes about 1 hour tops.

Fabulous Faberge!. We did a small group tour, just 10 of us with a guide, to the Faberge Museum. It was a great experience being in such as small group instead of the usual 40 or 50 in ordinary cruise ship's excursions.The palace which is the home of the museum, is in the centre of the St Petersburg, fronting onto one of the canals, and has been recently restored. The parquet / marquetry floors are spectacular, and are the reason why visitors have to wear overshoes.The museum also hosts a collection of other fine works from craftsmen who were contemporary to Faberge, and is quite extensive. But the jewel in the crown is the Faberge eggs - what a wonderful experience to be able to view such beautiful, and intricate masterpieces. I count myself as extremely privileged to have seen these beautiful and historical works of art for myself.

Amazing works of art. We visited the museum during a rather wet day in St Petersburg and wasn't disappointment. The Faberge eggs on display are truly magnificent and portray a number of important events in the late 19th and early 20th century. The other items in the Museam align with the impact of Russian arts on the rest of Europe, both from an imperial and cultural perspective. This Museam can be easily covered in 1 1/2 to 2 hour. Another tip is to Invest in an audio guide.

Gotta. Love a Faberge Egg. I hae always been facinated by Fabage eggs and we went in the sur if the moment. I found staf to be quite rude(more so than usual) why do we have to wear booties on our feet, cos we might get the carpet dirty? The museum was quiter good and i enjoyed it. Staff in the shop were to intereste in their phones to serve me so i left . If you love Fabage jewels and silver this is a place to see. Shame abou the saff

Beautiful museum. We visited this as part of our tour with SPB, and Luba, our guide, gave us so much information about all the exhibits, the architecture in the rooms was stunning, absolutely beautiful, and it was great to see the Faberge eggs.

Fabulous. We are so lucky that a Russian businessman had the foresight to buy all the faberge eggs and other items when they came onto the open market and open this museum for us to see them, he could you kept them just for himself. Thank you.

Astonishing. Everyone for sure heard about Fabergé, but the museum really gives you the background to history and detailed handcrafting functionality. The audio guide is highly recommended for insights into the technical skills.

Excellent. Due to unexisting parking possibilites for buses, the museum is not attacked by the global mass group tourism. Excellent! You can spend hours here, and have a coffe break in the beatuful coffe shop.

Nice museum in a beautiful building. Personally, I wouldn't have much interest in Faberge or the Romanov's cigarette boxes and jewellery, but to see the eggs up close and admire their stunning detail is worth visiting here alone. The interior of the building for me was the centerpiece of this museum. It's ornate and beautifully decorated. Price is a little steep for a small museum but considering the security required and the value of the items, it can be justified.

Worth visiting again and again. A huge collection of the Faberge jewelry. It lets you in to the royal extravagant way of life. The miniature work of art and the endless ways of decorating every day objects is amazing. The museum lets elf is so beautiful.

Don't miss this on your trip to St Petersburg. This museum is a must on your trip. The Eggs are a marvel full of surprises. The other works are magnificent in their own ways. Some of the best of their type - jewels, snuff boxes, enamel work, trinkets - I first thought I might be bored but it was quite the contrary. Our guide was extremely well informed and gave a most informative and breezy commentary as we went. It was well worth the hour and fifteen minutes we spent there.
Place of real beauty. A fantastic museum. Not just for Feberge eggs there was so much more. Wonderful things made of not just precious metals but jade and other stones. Be prepared to be blown away

A little disappointed. I thought we would see more Faberge eggs but there are very few. What artifacts there were were beautiful but I was a little disappointed but don't let that stop you going to this museum. It is worth a visit even if it only for the lovely coffee shop with great coffee and cakes.

Beautiful and interesting. Wonderful palace. Very informed guide. Wonderful and gorgeous and super interesting display of Faberge items. Just big enough so not overwhelming. Seeing the Faberge Easter eggs and learning about why they were produced made me realise that everything about them was special. A wonderful exhibition.

Spectacular!. For various reasons, I wasn't that excited about seeing the Faberge Museum. Boy, was I wrong! Don't miss this -- the eggs really ARE incredible, and the palace museum they're housed in is also pretty amazing. We had just come from the mob scene at Peterhof, and so the cool, uncrowded, lovely Faberge was truly a jewel of a museum. Go with a guide -- you'll see things you won't believe and wouldn't have noticed on your own.
Eggcelent. What a wonderful display! Faberge eggs so beautifully displayed. The workmanship is truly amazing. You really should go to visit this little museum.
Amazing collection. The Faberge Museum contains the wonderful Faberge eggs together with beautiful household creations. The Museum shop has a range of souvenirs at reasonable prices

One of my highlights!. I had seen the eggs before at the museum in Richmond, but I had no idea just how diverse Faberges creations were. The eggs, picture frames, service pieces, snuff boxes, etc. were just so beautiful that I didn't want to leave!
The Star in an Extraordinary City. This for us was the pinnacle of our visit to the city, a breathtaking collection; wonderfully displayed; set in an exquisite building.

Amazing craftsmanship . Everyone knows about the eggs. The 9 or so they have on display are amazingly intricate in person. The museums other Faberge items highlight the beautiful artists skill. Lots of boxes, cigarette cases, combs, etc. The building is gorgeous to boot. Would get a 5 if they had more information on the Faberge creation process. Definitely worth a visit and I've seen some of the eggs at the MET in NYC already.
Tour of this beautiful Museum. The amazing artefacts which have survived so much turmoil over the years within St Petersburg, The priceless pieces on display will take your breath away
Stunning Exhibits. Until you see these objects for real one just cannot appreciate the fantastic craftsmanship. Not just eggs ! Loving cups punch bowls and impressionist art too !

Unique Experience. The famous repatriated eggs of Carl Faberge are a must see. I believe there are eleven here, purchased at a cost of $180,000,000 from the estate of Malcolm Forbes.The experience was enhanced by a detailed description of the objects and their construction. But the eggs are not alone. The museum contains the finest examples of enamel, silver, and gold, jewelry and objects. If you like the good stuff, this is a must. On a par with the Imperial Treasury collection of the Habsburgs in Vienna. You can get great photos on line (mine are not) but to see them in person from all angles is a once in a life time treat.

Brilliant collection- worth seeing!. This museum is quite new and was not in my guide book. It houses 9 Imperial eggs as well as many other items made by Faberge. The eggs are so intricate - you can walk all way round the cases to see all angles. Opens till quite late.

Serious WOW Factor. If you are in St Petersburg and want to see some Faberge eggs this is the only place to go! Whilst The Hermitage does have one or two there is never any guarantee that you will see them and they are often out on loan.However at this beautifully restored palace you will see 10 Faberge eggs and lots of other beautiful enamel works by this celebrated artist. It is crowded, but they allow photos (without flash) and you are not hurried around. If you don't understand Russian it is probably best and eaisiest to book a guided tour which uses radio headphones so everyone can hear clearly.Definitely a highlight of our recent visit.

My favourite museum!!. I was impressed with the quality of the presentation and of course with the display itself. So many details to take into account for the small egg gifts, the stories behind them. All very well presented in the audio-guide. There is no queue which is amazing for a touristic attraction in Russia.

Don't miss this beautiful museum. We were here with a tour group (TJ Travel Co). The Faberge eggs are so incredibly beautiful, but there are many other lovely treasures to see. The inside of the museum is gorgeous. We could have spent a lot more time there, but that is the story of St. Petersburg - never enough time for all there is to see.

Fabulous. This is such a nice place. Started our day off by taking a 2 hour Canal Cruise from outside the Museum, a good way to see lots of the sights and buildings. Before we went into the museum we went into the Museum Cafe and sampled some Borche beetroot soup which was delicious. We then went into the museum. The building itself has undergone extensive renovation and is very palatial, sparkling chandeliers and ornate grand staircases. The display of Faberge eggs is wonderful, but there was an amazing collection of other beautiful items to view. I would highly recomend a visit to this museum.

Beautiful, but several steps to get in. It wasn't obvious, but you need to purchase tickets in one area, put on booties in another, then head upstairs. Staff politely tells you the sequence. Guided tours available, or you can tour independently. Pictures allowed!

Not just Faberge eggs. It's the place you go to in Saint Petersburg if you want to see some of the famous Faberge eggs. These are all in one room and then the rest of museum houses various other things such as clocks.

Fascinating. Terrific collection of beautiful objects. In addition to 9 Faberge eggs, there are a large noumber of other items by him, including cigarette cases, cuff links, and the like. There are also a large number of other beautiful objects by other craftsmen
Unbelievably beautiful eggs. Much more to see here than the eggs, although they were outstanding. Table service, paintings and more. Not enough time there, though.

Must see if you like Faberge Eggs. This is a small museum but has a great collection and has 14 Faberge Eggs which are all so beautiful. You can book a tour or just get an audio guide. There is a cafe a shop toilets and cloakroom onsite. You will be given shoe covers tower before entering

History through art. This museum is one of the privately sponsored ones in Saint Petersburg. Located is Shuvalovsky palace, which was renovated before the opening, it offers a nice collection not only of Faberge famous easter eggs, but also of other works of this brand and its contemporaries. Strongly recommend to take a tour - the guides are professionals (we had a tour with Maria with a short haircut - she was absolutely brilliant). This museum can offer you an unusual view on the late Tsar's Russia period - it's a nice example of high society's habits and values.
Fantastic collection, brilliantly lit. Huge collection of objects d'arts, very well presented and beautifully lit - even the oil paintings were lit in a novel but attractive light.

Absolutely Beautiful. I visited the Faberge Museum on my first day in St Petersburg. The interior architecture is just as beautiful as the eggs themselves. I was surprised to see other relics here, like fine jewels and religious items, and everything was stunning. Every room was so grand, and the items that were showcased in each room simply shined. I would love to visit here again.

Elegantlyh wonderful. This is a museum to love. Beautiful exhibits perhaps goes without saying but what makes visiting this museum such a joy is that great care is taken to manage the number of people so that everyone gets a chance to see the treasures without being jostled by crowds or rushed along. Visits are by set times and small groups are formed with hearing sets and a guide to make sure you do enjoy the visit despite its popularity.

Well organised, beautiful museum with must see treasures. The museum is housed in a beautiful building that holds as much history as its contents. you can pay extra for audio guides which are worth it for delving properly into the details of certain items on display as well as information on each room and the house as a whole. Next stop before you enter the museum proper is to the cloakroom to collect those very attractive overshoes which must be worn inside. Then it's up the sumptuous staircase and into the various rooms containing such a variety of Russian craftmanship - not just a stunning collection of Fabergé eggs but snuff boxes, paintings, gold and silver work, bronze and porcelain. Everything is very well presented and easy to photograph if the number of people peering at a particular showcase aren't too numerous! It's a sensory overload, the colours are beautiful and the items exquisite. Well worth a visit.

Gorgeous Jewels of the Czars and more!. Saw the seven or eight Faberge Eggs that were made for the Russian royal family and friends. Such fabulous works of art; a truly lost art now days. Also they have collections of silver, icons, mosaic works and all this is inside the Yusipov Palace, so each room also has beautiful details you shouldn't overlook. They have a very nice gift shop for artistic souvenirs.

One of my favorite museums. After a reasonably steep entry fee and audio guide (highly recommended) you gain access to a beautifully kept stately home which houses (I believe) the second largest collection of Faberge eggs. Incidentally the story of how they got there is worth 5mins on wikipedia... Anyway. Its a nice collection of exquisite jewellery and includes many other examples of items made by the Faberge workshop over the years. The audio tour takes you through their beginnings to being world respected craftsmen of the highest level - especially enamel work. Aside from the chance to see some of the most famous and valuable works of jewellery in the world, the museum isn't that long (compared to the endless labyrinth of the Louvre of Winter Palace) and you'll be out in an hour or two. After that you can buy your girlfriend a little Faberge egg...Make sure you stop by.

Fabulous! . One of my must dos in Russia was to see the Faberge eggs. We went to the Armory in Moscow and decided to also go to the Faberge museum in St Petersburg. I enjoyed seeing the eggs in Moscow but the museum in St Petersburg is much better. The eggs are displayed much better in St Petersburg. Each is in its own case so you can see them from all angles and they sell a limited number of tickets for each 30 minute time slot so the museum isn't crowded. The museum also includes beautiful enameled jewelry and boxes, jade and Russian icons.

A fabulous experience. A fabulous display of eggs and other Faberge pieces. We visited with a Russian tour guide. It was the best way to see the museum as she was able to give us the history of the museum and contents. Surprisingly, we were able to take photos. Your time in each room is limited due to the popularity of the exhibits.

Small as are the Eggs...but Exquisite!. A good side trip as it is not usually included on the major tours. Can be seen by oneself as well. It is small but really exquisite; in keeping with the Faberge Eggs! Only about 20% of the total made are here but very nice! Also worth the time are the rooms of other fine pieces of jewellery and inlaid art works.

Faberge at its finest. The Link of Times, the foundation responsible for this location, is accomplishing its mission and much more: to bring back to Russia pieces of its history that were scattered to the corners of the world following the revolution. The museum resides in the Shuvalov Palace which is impressive in and of itself (one of the few to survive the revolution and time). Nine Faberge Easter Eggs reside in this location, many more examples of Faberge art as well as many other Russian pieces of fine art representing the history of Russian.
Exquisite . The highlight for me were the magnificent eggs but there were many works of art. The security guard gave my husband a guide book to read which was very helpful.
The eggs are fantastic. There are 4 rooms inside including the one with the Faberge eggs in. We got a guide to listen to as well as paying to go in. Its still very inexpensive.

The Crown Jewels of st Petersburg. Walked down to this elegant palace off Nevsky prospekt not quite sure what to expect and not wholly by my own wishes.How unprepared for the craft skills of this phenomenal firm of jewellers. So many creations on display that showed the jewels and metals were not the main event but the inspired artistry was. Not the biggest lump of diamonds or gold in the world to be seen but certainly the finest museum of jewels anywhere.
Marvellous . Beautiful building. That's the first thing thet strikes you. Then the eggs. Exquisite. No other word for them. This is definitely a must see.
Great museum. Lovely museum with great state of art restaurant - good coffee.Helpful staff who arranged an uber taxi for us

Highlight of our trip. Hard to look at the Eggs and other treasures without being distracted by the marvellous room decorations. Each room decoration matched the exhibits. Beautiful Eggs, Object D'Arts and some excellent paintings. So many gorgeous exhibits to look at.

Enjoyable. This is a relatively new museum which I found interesting. The exhibitions are beautiful. It is not too much to take in and doesn't take too long to walk around. In the shop the Faberge egg pendants I thought were very expensive at over £200 for a CZ 1/2 inch pendant; even though it was very pretty I chose not to buy it.

Faberge Home At Last!. Until just recently, there was really no place in St. Petersburg to admire the Faberge Imperial Easter Eggs that were the signature of Carl Faberge. The museum is located in the Shuvalov Palace on the Fontanka River - one of the most beautiful palaces in St. Petersburg and was opened in 2014. This was our favorite museum. It houses the celebrated Fabergé collection of the Link of Times Foundation owned by Russian Entrepreneur Viktor Vekselberg, which, with its over 1,500 choice pieces, now easily outranks the comparatively small collection of the Kremlin Armory Museum. The collection includes over 200 objects formerly owned by the Forbes family in New York, in particular their nine Imperial and 6 non-Imperial eggs, all acquired by Mr. Vekselberg in 2004 for over $100 million.The collection has been vastly increased to cover all areas of Fabergé’s activity - monumental silver, colorful Muscovite enamels, and a multitude of cigarette cases, bell-pushes, frames, clocks and belt buckles in elegant transparent guilloché enamels. We were completely enthralled with the Imperial Eggs as well as the decorative and applied works made by the House of Faberge masters of the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The colors on the enamels are breathtaking – we were told that Carl Faberge used over 100 different colors and that the artisans of today have only been able to reproduce about 40 of them. The Museum is open every day except Friday from 10 am until 9 pm. Admission Fee.

The Faberge Museum Took Our Breath Away. There are no words to express the beauty of this museum and the beauty of the many collections. My husband and I were mesmerized by the intricacy of the Faberge Eggs as well as
the craftsmanship in the other exhibits. NOT TO MISS!
Mesmerising. Having read about the history of Faberge and having an understanding about the royal gifts, it was mesmerising to see the real thing
Stunning treasures. Really enjoyed this museum after visiting some of the much larger, overwhelming museums. Such wonderful treasures displayed in a beautiful setting - and it wasn't as crowded!

Beautiful Collection. This is a small museum (an hour and a half, at the most).Very nice selection of Faberge's work. Admission and audio guides can be charged, but 1000R in cash is required as a deposit. Other places will accept some form of identification as a deposit. If you are near the end of your visit and want to be rid of rubles, this could be a problem.

Don't miss this. Probably the highlight of my visit to SPB. After having endured crowds in most of the other sights, this place was very quiet so our guide was able to give a leisurely tour. There had been a naval festival in the city the same day so that perhaps explains the comparatively low number of visitors. The highlight of the collection is the nine Imperial Fabergé eggs which are just stunning. The collection includes the first and the last of the eggs. The first egg was quite modest in design, based on a trinket in the collection of the Danish royal family from which Tsarina was descended. The final egg too, created during the first world war, was also quite modest as befitted the time. In between times the eggs were just stunning. In addition to the Imperial eggs, there is a substantial collection of trinkets and decorative items created by Fabergé and his contemporaries which are well worth looking at. The building in which collection is housed is pretty special too - beautifully restored.
Stunning. What an amazing museum, well worth the visit. Faberge was such a talented jeweler, what intricate work and beautiful designs
WORTH A VISIT. This is a vast collection of Faberge and others art and crafts.there are room after room of fantastic pieces.Give yourself plenty of time to look around.
Stunning. How can something so small be so beautiful, certainly a work of art, could stay there without feeling rushed, just limited tour guide time, lots to see along side the Faberge eggs.

Nice Visit. Interesting villa, on the same level as Yusupof Palace, but smaller. The collection of Faberge Eggs is limited, but considering that most of those eggs are not in Russia anymore I guess it's ok. A visit that can be done after the main attractions have all been hit.

Wonderful - do not miss!. It's easy to get a bit blasé to bling in a place like St Petersburg but this collection is truly exceptional as well as the building that houses it. So much more in there than Faberge eggs.

More than just eggs. As this is a private museum it was much quieter (We also went in the evening) than places like the Hermitage.Being able to get up close to the cases you could take your time to appreciate the objects, I wouldn't bother with the audio guide though, it was more about the restoration than the art. You can take as many photos as you like which is different to many St Petersburg museums.As well as the eggs there are some stunning examples of enamel and silver work, though possibly the white backgrounds don't always show the lighter enamels off to their best advantage. Really worth a visit.
Disappointment. There are many museums that have had Faberge exhibits in the United States and some museums that have some in their permanent exhibits. The museum is expensive and disappointing.
Faberge Museum. You'll never see a better collection than this of Faberge's work. Thank you to the oligarch who made it possible for the public to see this magnificent collection and the house

Impressed. As this museum is a collection of private exponates it goes in contrast with the government museums - definetly comparison is notwithstanding - such an impressive collection in rather small palacewell, definetly worthseeing !!!take care of your tickets in advance via internet booking - overcrowed all the time!!!

What craftsmanship!. Everyone goes on about the eggs and indeed they are works of art - did you know each one took over a year to make? Not surprising when you see the details. But it was the other things too! Not a great fan of enamelling I was amazed by the intricacy of the art on the cigarette cases in particular - I loved the mix of silver work and painting. Also the museum houses a small collection of Russian Art. I do wish our tour had taken us to the Russian Museum as the art in the Hermitage was European and we get that at home. Visited at 6.30 one evening and at 8 (its open until 9) I had all the eggs to myself! Definitely the best time to visit.
must see. Faberge museum is a must see museum if you love museums . it was incredible and it worths ! we would love to visit again and use the audioguide.
Wonderful collection. Not just the Eggs, but also all the porcelain and the objects d'art. Get the Audio guide (300R), it is WELL worth the money! Open late till 9pm

So much more than just eggs!. My son wanted to go and see the eggs. The eggs are amazing, most open and have little surprises in side. But, the Fabrege collection is so much more than the eggs. There are rooms full of enameled silver and gold - lighters, cigarette boxes, silver bowls, etc... We shared an English guide phone. We loved the museum and highly recommend it.

Faberge Musuem. This was a spur of the moment decision. What a great move! The exhibits (especially the Faberge eggs made for the Romanov family) were fascinating. The story of Faberge and the eggs were brought to life by our guide. She was amazingly knowledgeable and enthusiastic. Can't say enough about our tour guide! What a great museum (and as a bonus; not overcrowded with tour groups like every other tourist spot in St Petersburg). The exhibits are housed in a palace, so it's a beautiful setting. Go!

The Fabulous Eggs. The Faberge eggs must be seen to be believed, the eggs are only the beginning as many other décor items are displayed, some of which are also by Faberge. You just have to see them to believe that they are so wonderful.

Spectacular. Obviously if you are going to this museum, then you have a good idea of what you are going to see, but, in real life the eggs are even more impressive. Expect outrageous opulence, and you will not be disappointed (nor will you be left in any doubt as to the cause of the Russian revolution!). As well as the eggs, there are hundreds of other items, and the building itself is beautiful too. There is a very nice cafe, which I believe is also a restaurant - but pricey though. Allow 2-3 hrs.
This place should not be missed!. The sheer beauty of these exhibits will stun you. The implied wealth of those who commissioned them and owned them will be shocking.
WOW. The Faberge Museum was absolutely amazing, the eggs are fabulous, definitely worth a visit. There is other pieces of jewellery there also to view. Highly recommend this tour.
fabulous Faberge. Awesome museum lovely to see these wonderful creations up close pictures do not do them justice Thoroughly recommended

Made my Head Spin!!. This is a lovely lovely museum. I prefer small intimate museums where you can spend your time really being able to see everything. This is not a museum for a quick walk through. Not does it have nine exquisite Faberge Eggs made for the Romanov family, but it has cases upon cases of other stunning examples of Russian made decorative items: photo frames, cigarette cases, snuff boxes and more. It is beautifully designed located in the lovely Shuvalov Palace. It is open until 8:45PM and I enjoyed visiting in the evening hours when there were no tour groups. You can take a guided tour during certain hours (check website) but I found the audioguide perfectly wonderful. But I would not visit without a tour or audiogude because you want to hear the fascinating stories of each egg and beautiful object. It is right off Nevsky Prospekt and easy to find.

Great museum, often overlooked as St. Petersburg has so much to offer. This is a great little museum, very centrally located off Nevsky pr. It is housed in a very beautiful building and has many other artefacts besides the Faberge eggs which are truly amazing feats of engineering and craftmanship.

Beautiful exhibit. Regret that we did not get the tour recorders to describe each article, but we were rushed for time and opted not to. Beautiful eggs and other pieces. Plan to spend a couple of hours at least to get full appreciation.

Stunning, simply stunning. Located on the Fontanka Embankment just down from the Anchikov Bridge in central St Petersburg, the collection housed here is unsurpassed and even puts the Hermitage to shame in the articles it contains. First we had to stow our bags in a locker and put covers over our shoes. Just walking into the rooms takes your breath away with their beauty and opulence – and that’s even before you look at the stuff in the glass cases.Silver, gold, malachite, filigree, cloisonné, enamel, etc, etc – even icons and portraits. Every room, every case more stunning than the last. A lot of ROMANOV items, including several Faberge eggs – even the one where the three miniature portraits emerge from beneath the crown. The most amazing and fabulous collection I have ever seen. The value of the items on show would be more than the GDP of most countries. Photography is allowed.
See many famous Faberge works of arts. Museum close to to Nevsky Prospects by the Fontanka Canal. You will see many famous Faberge eggs and juvelry.

Delightful smaller museum. The scale of many Russian museums can feel overwhelming but this is very manageable and leaves you with a sense that you've done it justice. It is well worth taking the audio guide or using the books they have there (which seemed freely available to borrow) as you tour the magnificent rooms and beautiful jewellery, objects and of course, the spectacular eggs. It also seems less busy than some museums - a welcome respite. Photography is permitted, entrance is not expensive, no queues, it has a small cafe and shop, and the guides and staff are friendly - what more could you ask for?

Enjoyable visit. I had particularly requested that the Faberge museum be added to our 3 day tour schedule. The eggs on display were of course magnificent as was the jewellery and other artefacts. Maybe I had over anticipated this visit as whilst it was very enjoyable I was a little disappointed to find fewer eggs than I had expected on display. However I am so glad to have seen such wonderful Faberge works and this was an experience I will remember for a very long time.
Jewel Box. This is a must-see in St Petersburg. The building was like a beautiful jewel box inside and the gorgeous jewelry is like nothing else you'll ever see.

Beautiful Museum. Go to this museum. Interesting decorative arts, more than the famous eggs. It is one of the few museums in St. Petersburg you can see on your own without a guide. Rent the audio guide (available in multiple languages). Tickets can be bought online a few days in advance.

Delightful. The Faberge museum is a delicious experience for those who like crafts and those other kind of arts. The eggs are a work of art <3 I loved the museum, the care they have for all the building and the information they offered (there were books in english that we can care around during the visit). I know there are many things that we can do in St. Petersburg, but this is a really good option if you have a little bit more time.

Superb. This is the bling almighty experience to end them all. Magnificent setting of opulent rooms, a marvellous collection of Imperial eggs, lots of other Faberge fripperies (including knitting needles). Our guide had excellent English and was very informative. Highly recommended
Museum. Samll but with a good variety of th artists work, very impressive and friendly understanding, my kids loved this place!

beautiful. We bought tickets online and we also got the guided tour. I am happy we did this as we had the chance to learn some things about Faberge, about how the eggs came about and more things about the Russian culture

Loved This!. It is hard to believe that this museum is only 3 years old. They have many Faberge pieces and pieces from contemporaries. The displays are easy to see and are filled with many pieces except for those with the famous eggs. Those have only the egg and 'surprises' from inside the egg if applicable. Faberge's work is unbelievable. I really loved this museum and highly recommend it.

Looks small but spare some time, it's worth it!. We thought we would be able to be done with this museum in an hour or so, you will need more time. It's a wonderful museum with so many hidden gems and it's not as warily crowded as Hermitage. Definitely recommend it.

Absolutely fabulous!. If you love beautiful things then you'll love this museum. It's packed full of fantastic objects including some of the famous eggs. The building itself is also lovely. Couldn't believe that this wasn't in our guide book, in a city full of lovely things it was a real highlight.

Beautiful displays of Faberge eggs. This is a small museum compared to many of the others in the city but the exhibits are magnificent. The 9 Faberge eggs are set out so they can be viewed and enjoyed from every angle and they are beautiful. Once you have have taken in the eggs there are further displays of enamelled objects, pictures and silver items. The building itself is also amazing and it is worth spending time looking at the walls, and ceilings to admire the architecture. If you don't have long in St Petersburg, you can get round this museum in about 1 hour.

Forget the eggs!. Really didn't care that much about the eggs and/or Faberge. The rest of the museum made up for a lot of it. You never hear about anything but the eggs, but the art in the other rooms was beautiful and almost seemed out of place in the egg museum. Skip the eggs and walk around. You'll be happy you did.

Wnderful. I didn't think I would care for this museum but once I was there Im glad I didn't miss it. The history and the stories behind the eggs are just amazing. It was very crowded, a lot of people were pretty rude trying to elbow there way in front of you. I'm used to taking my picture and moving on. A lot of tourists will take multiple pictures and continue to just stand there talking to the person there are with. There are too many people and very crowded to wait for the. To move, I ended up missing a lot of stuff. Off peak season would be better to visit.

More than just Eggs. While they have the best collections of Faberge Eggs in the world (they have acquired the Forbes collection) they have lots more. The jewelry display is breathtaking. They even have paintings by other Russian artists

Cruise ship tour - it's a must do!. This may only be a small museum but what they have stacks up against the larger museums.Limited numbers mean more space to circulate and appreciate the beauty of the pieces on display. Silver, ceramics, paintings and of course the Faberge eggs.Make this a part of your tour too!

Amazingly crafted finery, very well presented. I visited this solo as my partner has no interest in jewellery. I would recommend to leave your travel companion behind if they have little interest in this. As you will want to spend a while wondering around and going back to sections you've already seen. This is the second largest collection of fabergé eggs, and they are beautiful. The building that houses this collection is also amazing, like a mini hermitage palace.No bags are allowed in, but there is a fre cloakroom.I purchased ticket online then collected at desk. As I visited after 6pm (it's open till 8pm) there was few people there and no queue.

Beautiful!. A must see if in St Petersburg. We went as part of an organised tour and our tour guide was extremely knowledgable and very interesting. You can get really up close to the Faberge eggs and all the other items on display there. Beautiful building, good shop - well worth a visit.
Exquisite. You will see so many exquisite priceless pieces. The museum is well lite and displayed so you can take your time to truly appreciate the amazing work of all these artists.
No to be missed.. The museum has 10 Faberge eggs and so many more objects that Faberge created. Plus, the building is beautiful. Lovely boutique museum.
wonderful. So much to admire,not only the amazing Faberge eggs but all the other items of jewelry and items of beauty he produced

No problem visiting here. I was told you had to book in advance by 3 months but this was not true, I just paid and walked in. It has a fantastic display of many of the famous Faberge eggs, which look amazing in real life.

Stunning Building and decor, amazing exhibits. Just passing by and called in -WOW, I was not expecting that! Yes, Faberge are world renowned, how the level of detail goes into the workmanship is amazing, but they are not everything here. Loads of silver and gold objects as well as some extra intricate enamelwork and some paintings. Very impressed!

Fascinating - apart from the pick-pockets outside!. This really is a 'must do'. A wonderful selection of items - photography is permitted and the items in the shop are not over-priced.
A warning: when we exited the museum we were corralled against a parked car by four individuals hoping to pick our pockets. We pushed our way out and also recovered the money which they had dropped.

Schedule to go with a tour in your language. We thoroughly enjoyed this museum, such workmanship. Tough act to follow next wifeys b-day. Reviews had said you only have an hour, but after tour we were allowed to roam and retrace exhibit.

Beautiful items - wealth beyond wealth. Our tour around the Faberge museum was an eye opener. I knew of Faberge eggs, but it is amazing to see them first-hand. And to see the amazing clock-work design was mind-blowing.
But such wealth! No wonder there was a revolution!
Faberge Museum, - JAW dropping Experience. SPB Tours is incredible. The Faberge Museum was one of the sites in this AMAZING, once in a LIFETIME trip. Incredible!

Delightful Museum. This museum is not as large as many others in St. Petersburg but is in a lovely palace. Besides the fabulous Faberge Eggs there is also gorgeous silver and other works of art made by the Faberge factory.

Beautiful Display of Famed Eggs. Beautiful display of artistry and craftmanship of Jeweled Eggs commissioned by imperial family. Joining a tour is required to view museum. While interesting at first, the tour is quite lengthy and many in our group seemed to lose interest after 30 min.

A wonderful way to spend two houra. The collection not only of Imperial eggs but also all other types of Faberge production is wonderful. Absolutely absorbing and world class viewing. Graced by an excellent gift shop and a fine cafe, when done step outside and you can take the canal tour on the museum's own boat. Not to be missed.

More than Eggs. A small museum, the Faberge Museum is well worth visiting to view many beautiful items. While the Faberge eggs are amazing, there are a number of other rooms that feature beautiful silver pieces and give a wider sense of the Russian art aesthetic.
On your list. Beautiful collection of the works of Carl Faberge.One of the largest collection of Faberge eggs.Amazing jewellery

A Must See when in St. Petersburg. The Faberge Museum is one of those places that you must see when visiting St. Ptersburg. The collection of Faberge Eggs and other beautiful prices created in the Faberge Studio is awe inspiring. The attention to detail is amazing and each of the eggs housed in this collection represents a tribute to the reigning member of the royal family. Unique and meaningful gifts to them. The craftsmanship is exquisite, yet there is a whimsical side to this creativity as each piece has a hidden treat. Once again, do the tour with a trained and knowledgeable tour guide who can give you the "backstory" to each egg and other pieces.

Just what you'd expect. This private museum is housed in a restored palace and is completely gorgeous. The collection of Faberge eggs is just awesome. Having a tour guide or using the audio tour thingy is a complete requirement as there is no explanation on the display cases whatsoever. Hearing the history of the creation of each egg is interesting.

A Must See. Go early in the day as it does become very crowded. I was just there in June and you can take all the pictures you want. It is a fabulous museum and includes not only some of the Faberge eggs but many other articles of jewelery and gorgeous silver serving pieces for huge parties!I was on a tour so that helped to get us in and see all the best things.

Amazing. Big fan of this place- the building is as lovely as the content though the eggs steal the show. Have to wear shoe booties to protect the floor but not such a hassle. Manageable size- especially after the Hermitage. Check it out!

Faberge museum. Lovely small museum - recently restored Hosts about 9 of the original 50 eggs along with a lot of other beautiful art work from the house of FabergeDefinitely with a visit - an hour or so is sufficient

Gorgeous. Truly enjoyed this museum. See it for the beauty of the building! Even if your not interested in the Faberge collections. The building is stunning, every room has been renovated and done tastefully. It was the nicest building interior that we have seen so far, surpassing the Hermitage and Peterhof palace.
Small and sophiscated. It's a private museum that's on the small side and very pleasant. It's well organized and items are displayed in a way that's easy to view. A must see in St. Petersburg.
Craftsmanship. Housed in an elegant old palace are a wide array of faberge's creations. eggs, tablware, clocks, compasseseven fans. Fascinating.
Go....its wonderful. Fabulous museum, very beautiful items. A very comprehensive collection of Faberge glorious works. All set in a stunning palace

Fabulous. We had a private guide from Alla Tours which made this exhibit superior. Ramon explained each case in detail to us and our family had been briefed by someone on the Celebrity Cruise ship before going -so we had lots of questions and really enjoyed this. This location limits the number of people and therefore, it did not seem like you were being herded along like so many of the other locations.

A must. This was one of the highlights of St Petersburg. Not too crowded very enjoyable and you can borrow a guide that gives you description for each item. All breathtaking in particular the famous eggs and tea services. So beautiful and delicate

Worth seeing. The Faberge museum is really not just displaying faberge eggs. There are 14 of them on display along with some other items that were part of a collection. You can go through this museum in about an hour. There is just one floor of exhibits.
A nice museum of art. It is recommended to visit the museum to get acquainted with the art history of the period. The displays are really beautiful and unique.
Well worth a visit. A well run and organised private museum with some amazing skilled craftsmanship on display. Only small groups at a time nut worth a visit.

wonderful museum. fairly new and a bit off the beaten track but a must visit. well displayed items of superb quality. open for individual visits till 9pm. not too crowded so clear access and photos allowed.

COME HERE IF IN ST. PETERSBURG. This is one of the best things we did while in St. Petersburg. This collection is housed in an exquisite building, which that itself was worth the visit. The collection has slowly been collected, and it is very impressive that so many of these pieces have made their way back to St. Petersburg. The first and last imperial Easter Egg are housed here. In addition to Imperial Easter Eggs, other pieces of Feberge's work are here.
Bucket list tick.. It was an audio guided tor which was great. You could spend longer looking at the things you really liked and skip others. The guide is good and well thought out.
beautiful. Has the most beautiful collection of expensive and priceless objects'd art made for the Czars by the hose of Faberge'
Beautiful Museum. I had no idea just how amazing this place was going to be. Every faberge egg on display was so detailed and unique. Would definitely recommend a visit!

Beautiful and significant collection. Not to be missed, this was a highlight of my recent visit to St Petersburg. The museum is small but demonstrates the evolution of the famed egg beautifully. The crowds can be overwhelming but we had a great guide who got us in early and we had the display to ourselves!

10 eggs to see and learn about. We did this as our evening event, it is opened until 8 pm. It only took us an hour. It's a very easy visit. The museum has ten eggs to see and other things made by Faberege.
Love the eggs!. The collection of eggs is amazing! Also has tons of other knick knacks and many many icons - a must if you like icons!
Amazing!. At this well-designed museum, you actually get to see all of those amazing eggs, as well as the other fantastic art made by Faberge.

Amazing museum - A must see!!. The Faberge eggs and the collections of all the products Faberge produced are breathtaking and we absolutely enjoyed the museum. A definite must see when visiting St Petersburg. The museum is also located in a beautiful building, therefore it is a wonderful visit for those interested in the Faberge Eggs and also those interested in beautiful architecture. Audio Guide tour is definitely recommended as you get a lot of information that is not published in the visiting books available at the entrance, which are very hard to use as they are outdated and therefore list certain items as being located in different places. A visit to the coffeeshop is a great way to end the visit as they have great food options and coffee.

Exquisite artistry showcased in a beautiful surrounding. The Faberge Museum is a relatively new museum and it shows. The presentation cases, the lighting, the spacing is all clean and modern and well thought out. There are nine Imperial Faberge Eggs in the collection in addition to a myriad of enameled and non enameled artisan created works of art. This is a beautiful collection and well worth seeing. The staff speak good English, are friendly and very helpful. The café here is also very quaint with polite service and a good selection in a non-crowded environment. This was a delightful visit.

Faberge eggs, right?. This is a relatively short visit (at least for us). The whole egg as as a present idea is a bit crazy, and BTW, it is since the Romanovs already had way too much stuff that someone -- Faberge -- had to come up with a new gift and he did. Visit. This can be done in 30-45 minutes. We enjoyed it.

Must see when visiting St Petersburg, Russia. If you only have a limited time in St Petersburg I would suggest a tour of the Faberge Museum it is incredible. I would suggest a tour so you can hear the history of wach Faberge art work they are incredibly detailed and exquisite. There are many priceless exhibits in this museum so give yourself plenty of time it is totally unique.

Faberge is Fair. The museum has was nice enough, lots of Faberge items, but only 9 Faberge eggs. I'm not really a Faberge expert, so thats why I rated in average, there are lots of pieces to see but if you've been to the Hermitage after seeing that collection there isnt so much a wow factor at this museum. If you are a Faberge expert/enthusiast than this is for you.

A must do!. The chance to study the art of Faberge up close is something you should definetly take the time to do.
